Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.scanRuns.findings.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is too brief and lacks context about what Findings represent (vulnerabilities), pagination support, and return format. AI agents need to understand that Findings are vulnerability instances and how to handle paginated results.

data.current_description: List Findings under a given ScanRun.
data.summary_suggestion: List vulnerabilities found in a scan run
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all Finding resources (detected vulnerabilities) from a completed or in-progress ScanRun. Returns a paginated list of Finding objects, each representing a vulnerability instance identified during the scan. Supports filtering and pagination parameters to manage large result sets.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is too brief and lacks context about what Findings represent (vulnerabilities), pagination support, and return format. AI agents need to understand that Findings are vulnerability instances and how to handle paginated results.

message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description lacks context about what ScanConfigs contain, pagination support, and return format. AI agents need to understand that ScanConfigs define scan parameters and how to navigate results.

data.current_description: Lists ScanConfigs under a given project.
data.summary_suggestion: List scan configurations for a project
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all ScanConfig resources associated with a given project. Returns a paginated list of ScanConfig objects, each containing scan settings such as target URLs, authentication credentials, and scan parameters. Supports filtering and pagination to manage multiple configurations.

message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. data.current_description: Creates a new ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new web security scan configuration
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new ScanConfig resource that defines the parameters for a web security scan. Accepts a ScanConfig object specifying target URLs, authentication settings, and scan options. Returns the created ScanConfig with a generated resource name. The configuration is ready to be used to start scan runs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what inputs are required (ScanConfig object), what the response contains (generated resource name), or the side effect that the config becomes available for scanning. AI agents need clarity on the request/response structure and subsequent usage.

message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.scanRuns.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description mentions sort order but lacks context about what ScanRuns represent (actual scan executions), pagination support, and what information each ScanRun contains. AI agents need to understand the relationship between ScanConfig and ScanRun, and how to interpret the results.

data.current_description: Lists ScanRuns under a given ScanConfig, in descending order of ScanRun stop time.
data.summary_suggestion: List scan execution runs for a configuration
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all ScanRun resources associated with a given ScanConfig, sorted in descending order by stop time (most recent first). Returns a paginated list of ScanRun objects, each representing an actual execution of the scan configuration. Each ScanRun contains execution status, timing information, and links to discovered findings.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description mentions sort order but lacks context about what ScanRuns represent (actual scan executions), pagination support, and what information each ScanRun contains. AI agents need to understand the relationship between ScanConfig and ScanRun, and how to interpret the results.

data.current_description: Deletes an existing ScanConfig and its child resources.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a ScanConfig and its child resources
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an existing ScanConfig and all associated child resources including ScanRuns and Findings. This operation is permanent and cannot be undone. Requires the ScanConfig name/resource ID as input. Returns an empty response on successful deletion.

data.current_description: Gets a Finding.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific vulnerability Finding
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific Finding resource representing a vulnerability instance identified during a ScanRun. Requires the Finding resource name/ID as input. Returns the complete Finding object including vulnerability details, severity, and remediation information.

data.current_description: Updates a ScanConfig. This method support partial update of a ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Partially update a ScanConfig
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing ScanConfig with partial update support. Only provided fields in the request body will be modified; omitted fields retain their current values. message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.start' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about what happens when the operation executes (scan begins), what the request object contains, and what is returned. Added context about the side effect (scan initiation) and return value to help AI agents understand the operation's impact.

data.current_description: Start a ScanRun according to the given ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Start a security scan run
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a new ScanRun based on the specified ScanConfig. This operation begins the actual vulnerability scanning process according to the configuration parameters. Requires the ScanConfig resource name and a StartScanRunRequest. Returns a ScanRun resource representing the initiated scan with status and execution details.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about what happens when the operation executes (scan begins), what the request object contains, and what is returned. Added context about the side effect (scan initiation) and return value to help AI agents understand the operation's impact.

message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.scanRuns.stop' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description mentions return value but lacks input details and clarity about what stopping means operationally. Added summary and clarified that it halts the scanning process, specified input requirements, and improved return value description.

data.current_description: Stops a ScanRun. The stopped ScanRun is returned.
data.summary_suggestion: Stop an active security scan run
data.description_suggestion: Terminates an active ScanRun, halting the vulnerability scanning process. Requires the ScanRun resource name and a StopScanRunRequest. Returns the updated ScanRun resource with stopped status and final execution details.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description mentions return value but lacks input details and clarity about what stopping means operationally. Added summary and clarified that it halts the scanning process, specified input requirements, and improved return value description.

data.current_description: List Findings under a given ScanRun.
data.summary_suggestion: List vulnerabilities found in a scan run
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all Finding resources (detected vulnerabilities) from a completed or in-progress ScanRun. Returns a paginated list of Finding objects, each representing a vulnerability instance identified during the scan. Supports filtering and pagination parameters to manage large result sets.

data.current_description: Lists ScanConfigs under a given project.

data.current_description: Creates a new ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new web security scan configuration
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new ScanConfig resource that defines the parameters for a web security scan. Accepts a ScanConfig object specifying target URLs, authentication settings, and scan options. Returns the created ScanConfig with a generated resource name. The configuration is ready to be used to start scan runs.

Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what inputs are required (ScanConfig object), what the response contains (generated resource name), or the side effect that the config becomes available for scanning. message: Operation 'websecurityscanner.projects.scanConfigs.scanRuns.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description mentions sort order but lacks context about what ScanRuns represent (actual scan executions), pagination support, and what information each ScanRun contains. AI agents need to understand the relationship between ScanConfig and ScanRun, and how to interpret the results.

data.current_description: Lists ScanRuns under a given ScanConfig, in descending order of ScanRun stop time.
data.summary_suggestion: List scan execution runs for a configuration
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all ScanRun resources associated with a given ScanConfig, sorted in descending order by stop time (most recent first). Returns a paginated list of ScanRun objects, each representing an actual execution of the scan configuration. Each ScanRun contains execution status, timing information, and links to discovered findings.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description mentions sort order but lacks context about what ScanRuns represent (actual scan executions), pagination support, and what information each ScanRun contains. AI agents need to understand the relationship between ScanConfig and ScanRun, and how to interpret the results.

data.current_description: Deletes an existing ScanConfig and its child resources.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a ScanConfig and its child resources
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an existing ScanConfig and all associated child resources including ScanRuns and Findings. This operation is permanent and cannot be undone. Requires the ScanConfig name/resource ID as input. Returns an empty response on successful deletion.

data.current_description: Gets a Finding.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific vulnerability Finding

data.reasoning: Missing summary and overly generic description. 'Gets a Finding' doesn't convey that this retrieves vulnerability information. Added domain context about what a Finding represents, input requirements, and what the response contains to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Updates a ScanConfig. This method support partial update of a ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Partially update a ScanConfig
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing ScanConfig with partial update support. Only provided fields in the request body will be modified; omitted fields retain their current values. data.current_description: Start a ScanRun according to the given ScanConfig.
data.summary_suggestion: Start a security scan run
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a new ScanRun based on the specified ScanConfig. This operation begins the actual vulnerability scanning process according to the configuration parameters. Requires the ScanConfig resource name and a StartScanRunRequest. Returns a ScanRun resource representing the initiated scan with status and execution details.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about what happens when the operation executes (scan begins), what the request object contains, and what is returned. data.current_description: Stops a ScanRun. The stopped ScanRun is returned.
data.summary_suggestion: Stop an active security scan run

data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description mentions return value but lacks input details and clarity about what stopping means operationally. Added summary and clarified that it halts the scanning process, specified input requirements, and improved return value description.
